llm_text:
Why:
- payment_format_ach (value=1) had the largest positive SHAP (+2.902), so the ACH payment format was the primary driver increasing the model score.
- amount_received (15968.2) and amount_paid (15968.2) had positive SHAPs (+0.900 and +0.764), so the relatively large transaction amount contributed to increasing the score.
- dayofweek (6) had a positive SHAP (+0.782), so the transaction occurring on dayofweek=6 (Sunday) further increased the score.
- from_bank (908) had a negative SHAP (−0.922), indicating that this specific sending bank reduced the model score (partially offsetting the increases above).

Conclusion:
The transaction was flagged mainly because payment_format_ach combined with the sizeable amount (amount_received/amount_paid ≈ 15,968.2) and timing on dayofweek=6 produced the largest positive contributions to the model score; the sending bank (from_bank=908) reduced the score but did not fully offset those increases. Conditionally, when payment_format_ach = 1 together with high amount values and dayofweek = 6, the model’s predicted risk tends to be higher (even if certain from_bank values can lower it).
